Signal Explanations.rst: asynchronous reset input used to initialize and reset the counter logic
Signal Explanations.sig: output signal that indicates when the Gray-coded counter equals zero

Logical Operators Explanation.s_eventually: a temporal operator requiring that the contained condition eventually holds true at some future clock cycle
Logical Operators Explanation.||: logical OR operator meaning that at least one of the contained conditions must be true
Logical Operators Explanation.==: equality operator indicating that the compared value must be exactly equal to a constant

Assertion 1.Assertion Explaination: eventually, either the asynchronous reset input is active or the output signal that indicates a zero value in the Gray-coded counter is equal to one; that is, at some future clock cycle, it must hold that one of these conditions is satisfied
